title: Theory and models of $(\infty,ω)$-categories
abstract:
This thesis is divided into two parts. In the first part, we study models of $(\infty,ω)$-categories. The main result is to establish a Quillen equivalence between Rezk's complete Segal $Θ$-spaces and Verity's complicial sets.
  In the second part, we study the $(\infty,1)$-category corresponding to these two model structures, denoted by $(\infty,ω)$-cat. Its connection with Rezk's complete Segal $Θ$-spaces allows us to use the globular language, while its connection with complicial sets gives us access to a fundamental operation, the Gray tensor product. The objective will be to implement standard categorical constructions in the context of $(\infty,ω)$-categories. A special emphasis will be placed on the Grothendieck construction.
